events.originalText: In the United Kingdom, Liz Truss succeeded Boris Johnson as Prime Minister, ending the July 2022 United Kingdom government crisis.
events.subtitle: Liz Truss
events.headline: Liz Truss becomes UK Prime Minister, succeeding Boris Johnson

events.originalText: The Supreme Court of India invalidated part of Section 377 of the Penal Code, thus legalising homosexuality in India.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of India
events.headline: India legalizes homosexuality as Supreme Court invalidates Section 377

events.originalText: Hurricane Irma (pictured) reached peak intensity and reached the Carribbean islands of Barbuda, Saint Martin, and Virgin Gorda.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Irma
events.headline: Hurricane Irma hits Barbuda, Saint Martin, and Virgin Gorda in the Caribbean

events.originalText: The Parliament of Singapore relocated from the Old Parliament House to its current meeting place (pictured).
events.subtitle: Parliament of Singapore
events.headline: Singapore Parliament relocates to new meeting place

events.originalText: An estimated 2.5 billion people worldwide watched the funeral of Diana, Princess of Wales, on television.
events.subtitle: Funeral of Diana, Princess of Wales
events.headline: 2.5 billion people watch funeral of Princess Diana on TV

events.originalText: Cal Ripken Jr. played his 2,131st consecutive Major League Baseball game, breaking the 56-year-old record set by Lou Gehrig.
events.subtitle: Cal Ripken Jr.
events.headline: Cal Ripken Jr. breaks consecutive MLB game record

events.originalText: Soviet pilot Viktor Belenko landed his MiG-25 in Hakodate, Japan, declaring his intention to defect to the West.
events.subtitle: Viktor Belenko
events.headline: Soviet pilot Viktor Belenko defects to the West in Japan

events.originalText: The Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine hijacked four airliners, landing two at Dawson's Field in Jordan and one in Cairo, while the last hijacking attempt was foiled.
events.subtitle: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
events.headline: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine hijacks airliners

events.originalText: The Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine hijacked four airliners, landing two at Dawson's Field in Jordan and one in Cairo, while the last hijacking attempt was foiled.
events.subtitle: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine
events.headline: Last hijacking attempt by Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine foiled

events.originalText: The Kennedy administration sent Victor H. Krulak and Joseph Mendenhall on a mission to assess the progress of the Vietnam War.
events.subtitle: Presidency of John F. Kennedy
events.headline: Kennedy administration sends mission to assess Vietnam War progress

events.originalText: A prototype aircraft crashed at the Farnborough Airshow in Hampshire, England, killing the pilot and test observer on board, and 29 spectators.
events.subtitle: 1952 Farnborough Airshow crash
events.headline: Prototype aircraft crash at Farnborough Airshow kills pilot, test observer, and 29 spectators

events.originalText: World War II: Soviet forces captured the city of Tartu on their way to re-establishing their rule in Estonia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet forces capture city of Tartu in Estonia during World War II

events.originalText: Argentine president Hipólito Yrigoyen was deposed in a military coup by José Félix Uriburu.
events.subtitle: Hipólito Yrigoyen
events.headline: Argentine president Hipólito Yrigoyen deposed in military coup

events.originalText: The first self-service grocery store, Piggly Wiggly, was founded in Memphis, Tennessee, U.S.
events.subtitle: Grocery store
events.headline: First self-service grocery store, Piggly Wiggly, founded in Memphis, Tennessee

events.originalText: William McKinley, President of the United States, was fatally wounded by anarchist Leon Czolgosz at the Pan-American Exposition in Buffalo, New York, and died eight days later.
events.subtitle: William McKinley
events.headline: President William McKinley fatally wounded by anarchist Leon Czolgosz

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: General Benedict Arnold led British forces to victory at the Battle of Groton Heights.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: General Benedict Arnold leads British forces to victory at Battle of Groton Heights

events.originalText: Suleiman I, the longest reigning sultan of the Ottoman Empire, dies at the age of 71.
events.subtitle: Suleiman the Magnificent
events.headline: Longest reigning Ottoman Sultan Suleiman I dies at 71

events.originalText: Christopher Columbus set sail from San Sebastián de La Gomera, before a five-week voyage across the Atlantic to the Americas.
events.subtitle: Christopher Columbus
events.headline: Christopher Columbus sets sail from San Sebastián de La Gomera to the Americas
